Exaggeration: The claim exaggerates the benefits of NAFTA by stating that both Mexico and Canada have "such great deals" under the agreement. This may be an overstatement of the actual benefits and deals achieved by the countries.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or specific examples to support the statement that both Mexico and Canada have great deals under NAFTA. It lacks sufficient supporting information.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that both Mexico and Canada have equally favorable deals under NAFTA, without providing any justification or evidence for this assumption. It may overlook potential differences in the benefits and outcomes for each country.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider or acknowledge the possibility that there may be alternative explanations or perspectives regarding the deals made by Mexico and Canada under NAFTA. It presents a one-sided view without considering other possible interpretations.
